comment: Under normal circumstances the two minor pieces will clearly get the worst of it against the Queen; but the purpose of this example is to show that given favourable conditions the minor pieces can make things very difficult - say difficult, indeed, that the Queen may even have to pay the piper. Here White has some lead in development, while the Black king must stay in the middle for the time being. To make use of these factors, White must attack at once.
